alert.note: Alert for Cameron; McKean; Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MCKEAN...WESTERN POTTER AND NORTHEASTERN CAMERON COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking 2 strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 24 miles southeast of Olean to 19 miles east of St. Marys. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Wharton, Coudersport, Port Allegany, Emporium, Roulette, Cherry Springs State Park, Denton Hill State Park, Keating Summit, Sizerville, Austin, Sweden Valley, Oswayo and Ski Denton Ski Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
